authors: Frank Coletta For Daily Mail Australia
description: A young girl has been bitten by a snake while playing at Boreen Point on the Queensland Sunshine Coast. The seven-year-old is in Noosa Hospital in a stable condition.
title: Queensland girl in hospital after being bitten by a snake on Sunshine Coast
title_page: Queensland girl in hospital after being bitten by a snake on Sunshine Coast | Daily Mail Online
text:
A girl, 7, has been bitten on the foot for a snake in Boreen Point on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.
Paramedics were called to Laguna Street shortly before 1pm where they treated the child for the bite.
She was stabilised at the scene before being transported to Noosa Hospital, about 20 kilometres away.
The seven-year-old remains in a stable condition in hospital where staff have undertaken toxicology tests.
It's still unclear what type of snake attacked her near a sports and recreation area of the suburb.
A seven-year-old girl is in Noosa Hospital after being bitten by a snake at Boreen Point on the Sunshine Coast
